English: Aaargh!
Korean: 우, 우와아―――!
German: Aaargh!

English: Agumooon! Gabumooon! Are you okay?!
Chinese: 亞古獸！　加布獸！　你們沒事吧！？
Korean: 아구몬! 파피몬! 괜찮아!?
German: Agumooon! Gabumooon! Geht es euch gut?!

English: Ww-We're sorry, Nokia...
Chinese: 對、對不起喔，諾奇雅……
Korean: 미, 미안, 노키아……
German: T-Tut uns leid, Nokia ...

English: He was really strong...
Chinese: 這孩子，好強喔……
Korean: 이 애, 굉장히 강했어……
German: Er war so stark ...

English:
Don't blame yourselves, Agumon, Gabumon! We all
share the responsibility for hacker battles!
It's my fault for being so weak!
Chinese:
不要怪自己了，亞古獸、加布獸！
在駭客戰鬥中能決定出勝負的，是駭客的力量……！
都怪我太不成熟！
Korean:
자신을 탓하지 마, 아구몬, 파피몬!
해커 배틀의 승부를 가르는 건 해커의 역량…!
내가 미숙한 게 잘못인걸!
German:
Macht euch nichts daraus, Agumon, Gabumon! Wir
alle teilen die Verantwortung für Hackerkämpfe!
Es ist meine Schuld, weil ich so schwach bin!

English: But I promise I will avenge you!
Chinese: 這份仇，我一定會報的！
Korean: 이 원수는 반드시 갚아주겠어!
German: Aber ich verspreche, euch zu rächen!

English:
Now bring it!
Now you've got a real fight on your hands!
Chinese: 來，打過來吧！　這次就來以真人格鬥來分──
Korean: 자아 덤벼봐! 이번엔 리얼파이트로 승부――
German:
Dann zeig, was du kannst! Nun, da du dir einen
echten Kampf eingehandelt hast!

English:
Actually a real fight is too dangerous.
How about a hot dog eating contest!
Or perhaps a noodle eating contest!
Chinese:
但是真人格鬥會很痛，
果然還是比看誰吃熱狗比較快好了！
小碗蕎麥麵也可以喔！
Korean:
아~ 역시 리얼파이트는 아플 것 같으니까
핫도그 빨리먹기 경쟁으로 승부야!
완코소바 빨리먹기 경쟁이라도 가능!
German:
Eigentlich ist ein echter Kampf zu gefährlich.
Wie wär’s mit einem Hotdog-Wettessen?
Oder doch lieber Soba-Nudeln?

English:
Miss Akkino! Please calm down!
Don't forget our primary mission here!
Chinese:
等、等等啊！　雅奇諾大人，冷靜下來啊！
不能忘記我們一開始的目的啊！
Korean:
자, 잠깐잠깐! 앗키노 씨, 진정해요!
원래 목적을 잊으면 안 돼요!
German:
Fräulein Akkino! Bitte beruhig dich!
Vergiss nicht unser Hauptziel hier!

English: Oh, that's right... He he.
Chinese: 啊、對喔……啾咪☆
Korean: 아, 그랬지……에헷☆
German: Oh, stimmt ja ... Hehe.

English: Ho ho... He he he...
Chinese: 嘻……嘻嘻嘻……
Korean: 크……큭큭큭……
German: Hoho ... Hehehe ...

English:
Woohoo hoo... Ha! He he he Oh ho ho!
Aaah! Oh...my poor stomach!
Chinese:
嗚嘻嘻……噗……　啊～哈哈哈哈哈！！
嘻～！　嗚哈哈哈哈哈！　肚、肚子好痛！
Korean:
푸큭큭……크……윽  아~핫핫핫!!
히~! 푸하하하하하하! 배, 배 아파!
German:
Huhuhu ... Ha! Hehehe, ohoho!
Aaah! Oh ... Mein armer Bauch!

English:
Ha ha ha... Haven't laughed like that in a while.
Sorry, I didn't mean to scare you.
Chinese:
哈哈哈……啊，真是太好笑了……
抱歉啊……嚇了你一跳。
Korean:
하하……아, 웃었다 웃었다……
미안……놀라게 했지
German:
Hahaha ... Lange nicht mehr so gelacht.
Tut mir leid, ich wollte dich nicht erschrecken!

English:
This whole kidnapping thing...
Actually it's just my little prank!
Chinese: 這場綁架……其實是我的惡作劇。
Korean: 이 유괴……실은 내 장난이었거든!
German:
Diese ganze Entführung ... war tatsächlich nur ein
Streich von mir!

English:
After I split up with you in EDEN, it was too
boring for me to just hang around the shop, so
I kinda started wandering around.
Chinese:
在EDEN跟你分開後，待在店裡也很尷尬，
所以我就到了外面隨意亂晃。
Korean:
EDEN에서 너랑 헤어진 이후로 가게에도 있기 힘들어져서
갈 데 없이 어정대고 있었거든
German:
Nachdem wir in EDEN getrennter Wege gingen,
wurde es mir langweilig, im Café rumzuhängen,
also bin ich durch die Gegend gelaufen.

English:
Then I ran into her and we really hit it off...
We decided to pull a fast one on you by bringing
you here
Chinese:
結果就遇到這群傢伙，意外的很合得來……
把你叫出來，卻情不自禁跟他們一起演了一場戲。
Korean:
그러다 이 녀석들을 만나 의기투합해서……
너를 불러내기 위해 한바탕 연극를 해 주게 된 거지
German:
Dabei bin ich ihr begegnet und wir haben uns auf
Anhieb verstanden ... Wir wollten dich reinlegen,
indem wir dich hierherlocken ...

English: Sorry we scared you, [p]!
Chinese: 抱歉嚇了你一跳喔，[p]！
Korean: 놀라게 해서 미안해, [p] 군!
German:
Tut mir leid, dass wir dich erschreckt haben,
[p]!

English:
I'm Nokia Shiramine!
I'm the leader of the Rebels Tamer Team!
Chinese:
我是白峰諾奇雅！
是馴獸師隊伍「反叛者」的隊長喔！
Korean:
나는 시라미네 노키아!
테이머 팀「리벨리온즈」의 리더야!
German:
Ich heiße Nokia Shiramine!
Ich bin die Anführerin des Zähmer-Teams „Rebels“!

English:
This is Agumon and Gabumon!
We're super-close partners tied together by fate!
Chinese:
這些孩子們是亞古獸跟加布獸！
我們是命運的強大牽絆組成的夥伴喔！
Korean:
이 애들은 아구몬과 파피몬!
우리들은 운명의 단단~한 유대로 맺어진 파트너야!
German:
Das sind Agumon und Gabumon!
Wir sind unzertrennliche Schicksalsgefährten!

English: Great to meet ya!
Chinese: 請．多．指．教．囉☆
Korean: 잘 부 탁 해★
German: Schön, dich kennenzulernen!

English:
So, Chitose, is that it for our little make-
believe session?
Chinese: 千歲，已經不用演戲了吧？
Korean: 저기, 치토세. 이제 연극은 끝?
German:
Also, Chitose, war’s das mit unserem
kleinen Schauspiel?

English:
Yeah, you were great!
I owe ya one!
Chinese:
喔，謝謝你們啦。
真是多虧了你們呢。
Korean:
오우, 고마워.
너희들 덕분에 살았어.
German:
Ja! Du warst toll!
Ich schulde dir was!

English:
He he, I don't really get it, but it was fun!
Huh, Nokia?
Chinese:
嘿嘿，雖然搞不太懂，但好開心喔！
對吧諾奇雅？
Korean: 에헤헤, 잘은 모르겠지만 즐거웠지! 노키아.
German:
Hehe, ich kapier’s nicht ganz, aber es hat
Spaß gemacht! Nicht wahr, Nokia?

English: Yeah! You two deserve an award, Agumon and Gabumon!
Chinese: 嗯！　演得真是太棒了，亞古獸、加布獸☆
Korean: 응! 명연기였어, 아구몬, 파피몬♥
German:
Ja! Eine preisverdächtige Leistung,
Agumon und Gabumon!

English: Huh...? I've seen you before...
Chinese: 咦……？　你，好像在哪裡──
Korean: 어라……? 너, 어딘가에서――
German: Hm ...? Dich kenn ich doch ...

English: Ah, I remember now!
Chinese: 啊，我想起來了！
Korean: 아, 생각났다!
German: Ah, jetzt erinnere ich mich!

English: Look, Agumon!
Chinese: 亞古獸，你看！
Korean: 봐봐, 아구몬!
German: Schau, Agumon!

English:
This is the one who saved us when we were being
chased by that scary guy in Kowloon!
Chinese:
這個人，就是我們在Kowloon被恐怖的人追時，
救了我們的人喔！
Korean:
이 사람, 쿠롱에서 무서운 사람에게 쫓길 때
구해줬던 사람이야!
German:
Das ist der Typ, der uns gerettet hat, als wir von
dem gruseligen Kerl in Kowloon verfolgt wurden!

English:
Ah! You're right!
We wanted to thank you!
Chinese:
啊──！　真的耶──！
我們一直想跟你道謝喔！
Korean:
아!  정말이네!
우리들은 너에게 계속 인사를 하고 싶었어!
German:
Ah! Du hast recht!
Wir wollten dir danken!

English: Yeah, thanks so much for saving us!
Chinese: 謝謝你那時候救了我們！
Korean: 그 때 구해줘서 고마워!
German: Ja, vielen Dank, dass du uns gerettet hast!

English: Thanks!
Chinese: 謝謝你！
Korean: 고마워!
German: Danke!

English: Oh, so you saved Agumon and Gabumon, huh.
Chinese: 這樣啊，就是你救了亞古獸跟加布獸啊。
Korean: 그런가, 네가 아구몬과 파피몬을 구해줬었구나
German: Oh, du hast also Agumon und Gabumon gerettet, wie?

English: I want to thank you too!
Chinese: 那我也得謝謝你！
Korean: 나도 인사를 하고 싶어!
German: Ich möchte dir auch danken!

English:
If you hadn't saved Agumon and Gabumon, I wouldn't
even have met them!
Chinese:
要不是你救了他們，
我就沒辦法見到亞古獸跟加布獸了！
Korean:
네가 구해주지 않았으면 나도 아구몬과 파피몬을
만나지 못했을 테니까!
German:
Hättest du Agumon und Gabumon nicht gerettet,
wäre ich ihnen nie begegnet!

English: Ah! I remember now!
Chinese: 啊……！　我想起來了！
Korean: 아…! 나, 생각났어!
German: Ah, jetzt erinnere ich mich!

English:
When we were being chased by that scary guy in
Kowloon, this is the one who joined in and tried
to capture us!
Chinese:
這個人，就是我們在Kowloon被恐怖的人追時，
想要抓我們的人！
Korean:
이 사람, 쿠롱에서 무서운 사람에게 쫓길 때
같이 잡으려고 했던 사람이야!
German:
Als wir von dem gruseligen Kerl in Kowloon
verfolgt wurden – er war es, der sich ihm
angeschlossen und versucht hat, uns zu fangen!

English: Yeah, it's him! Yikes!
Chinese: 啊，真的！　是那時候的人！
Korean: 아앗, 정말이네! 그 때의!
German: Ja, das ist er! Auweia!

English:
What?! You tried to capture them?!
You're a Digimon snatcher?!
Chinese:
什麼！？　原來你才是……曾經是綁架犯！
你綁架過數碼寶貝！？
Korean:
뭣이라!?  너야말로 어린이 유괴범… 아니!
디지몬 유괴범이었어!?
German:
Was?! Du hast versucht, sie zu fangen?!
Du bist ein Digimon-Jäger?!

English:
But you didn't try to capture us right away.
It was like you were trying to make up your mind.
Chinese:
可是……你那時候沒有立刻把我們抓起來，
好像是在猶豫……
Korean:
하지만……너, 그때 바로 우리들을 잡으려고는
하지 않았지. 꼭 망설이고 있었던 듯한…
German:
Aber du hast nicht gleich versucht, uns zu fangen.
Du schienst dich nicht entscheiden zu können.

English: ...Say, are you a good guy? Or a bad guy?
Chinese: ……你是好人嗎？　還是壞人呢？
Korean: ……저기, 너는 좋은 사람이야? 아니면 나쁜 사람?
German:
... Also, bist du einer von den Guten?
Oder ein Schurke?

English:
Was that back when we were chasing Shiga?
Relax! He's a good guy for sure!
Chinese:
那是你在追志賀那時候的事吧？
安心吧！　這傢伙是個好人！
Korean:
아아, 그건 시가를 쫓고 있을 때 얘기지?
안심해! 이 녀석은 좋은 녀석이니까!
German:
War das damals, als wir Shiga verfolgt haben?
Bleibt locker! Er gehört natürlich zu den Guten!

English:
After all, he's the one who took down Shiga.
Anyway, I'll vouch for him personally.
Chinese:
再怎麼說，就是這傢伙打倒了志賀。
我來替這傢伙做保證，就相信他吧！
Korean:
뭣보다 시가를 쓰러뜨린 것도 이 녀석이야.
이 녀석에 대한건 내가 보증할테니 믿어보라구!
German:
Immerhin war er es, der Shiga erledigt hat.
Wie dem auch sei, ich bürge persönlich für ihn.

English:
Well then, that's good enough for us!
Eh, Agumon! Gabumon?
Chinese:
千歲都這麼說，那我就安心了！
對吧，亞古獸、加布獸？
Korean:
치토세가 그렇게까지 말한다면 안심이야!
저기, 아구몬, 파피몬?
German:
Tja, das reicht uns!
Oder, Agumon, Gabumon?

English: Yeah! Thanks for taking Shiga down!
Chinese: 嗯！　謝謝你打倒他！
Korean: 응! 그 놈을 해치워줘서 고마워!
German: Ja! Danke, dass du Shiga ausgeschaltet hast!

English: Thanks!
Chinese: 謝謝你！
Korean: 고마워!
German: Danke!

English:
Ha ha, anyway, we sure fooled him!
He really thought it was a kidnapping, huh?
Chinese:
嗯呵呵，不過你還真是被騙得團團轉呢。
你真的以為千歲被綁架了吧？
Korean:
우훗훗훗, 그건 그렇고 멋지게 속아넘어갔군.
진짜 유괴라고 생각해버렸지?
German:
Haha, jedenfalls haben wir ihn ganz schön
reingelegt! Er dachte wirklich, wir wären
Entführer, wie?

English:
Nah, I think he was just playing with us!
You've gotta be the worst ham ever, Akkino!
Chinese:
不，我想他立刻就看穿了喔！
畢竟雅奇諾大人的演技太差了！
Korean:
아니, 아마 처음부터 다 들켰다고 생각함다!
앗키노 씨 너무 발연기였으니까!
German:
Nö, ich glaube, er hat uns nur was vorgemacht!
Das war aber auch dick aufgetragen – wie in
einem dieser alten Schinken Akkino!

English:
No way! I think I was a great thespian!
What did you think, Agumon and Gabumon?
Chinese:
咦～騙人的吧！　那可是能媲美好萊塢女星，
還能拿奧斯卡獎的演技耶！
對吧，亞古獸、加布獸？
Korean:
에~ 거짓말~!  할리우드 여배우같은
오스카 수상감 연기였지? 아구몬, 파피몬?
German:
Gar nicht! Mich hat eindeutig die Muse geküsst!
Was meint ihr, Agumon und Gabumon?

English: Thespian? But I thought you liked guys?
Chinese: 澳司卡槳？　那是什麼？
Korean: 하리우드 여배우? 술이야?
German: Die Muse? Und ich dachte, du magst nur Jungs!

English: And how are you a ham? Cause you taste good?
Chinese: 三劉眼圓是什麼？　好吃嗎？
Korean: 발연기가 뭐야? 그거 맛있어?
German:
Und was ist an Schinken denn schlecht?
Schmeckt er dir nicht?

English: No, cause I like to eat bacon!
Chinese: 真是的，你們這群貪吃鬼──
Korean: 정말~ 먹보라니까~
German: Nein, ich mag lieber Speck!

English: Strange bunch, aren't they?
Chinese: 喂，他們真是群怪傢伙對吧？
Korean: 뭐, 이상한 녀석들이지?
German: Komische Truppe, oder?

English:
But they helped me laugh and relax a lot,
so I'm feelin' way better.
Chinese:
但是，多虧了他們的傻氣，
讓我的心情好很多了。
Korean:
하지만 이 녀석들의 바보짓 덕분에
제법 마음이 편해졌어
German:
Aber sie haben mich zum Lachen gebracht und mir
geholfen, mich zu entspannen – jetzt geht es mir
viel besser.

English:
...I was really struggling over whether to talk to
you about Ryuji.
Chinese:
……我之前很迷惘，
不知道該不該跟你說龍司的事。
Korean:
……망설이고 있었거든.
너에게 류지에 대해 말해야할지 어떨지로
German:
... Ich habe mit der Entscheidung gerungen,
ob ich dir von Ryuji erzählen soll.

English: But...you want to know, right?
Chinese: 但是……你想知道對吧？
Korean: 하지만……알고싶지? 넌
German: Aber ... Du willst es wissen, nicht wahr?

English:
Yeah, I guess I can't keep it a secret anymore.
Okay, here goes...
Chinese:
我就知道。看來不能再繼續保密下去了，
我就下定決心說出來吧。
Korean:
그렇겠지. 이 이상 입을 다물고 있을 수도 없으니까.
나도 결의를 다질게
German:
Ja, ich schätze, ich kann es nicht länger für mich
behalten. Okay, es ist so ...

English: ...He's secretly working with Kamishiro.
Chinese: ……那傢伙，暗地裡和神代企業有勾結。
Korean: ……그 녀석은 카미시로와 뒤에서 손을 잡고 있었어
German: Er arbeitet heimlich mit Kamishiro zusammen.

English:
That last job breaking into that server...
It was ordered by Kamishiro.
Chinese: 之前侵入伺服器……那也是神代企業的指示。
Korean: 얼마 전 있었던 서버 침입……그것도 카미시로의 지시였지
German:
Der letzte Auftrag, in diesen Server
einzubrechen ... kam von Kamishiro.

English:
He pretended he was doing a job for Yuugo,
and he deleted the data we were looking for.
Chinese:
他假裝是要完成YUGO的委託，
暗地裡刪除掉我們要的資料。
Korean:
유고에게서 의뢰를 받은 의뢰를 처리하는 척 하고 류지는
우리들이 노리고 있던 데이터를 삭제하고 있었어
German:
Er hat so getan, als würde er für Yuugo arbeiten,
und die Daten gelöscht, nach denen wir suchten.

English:
For all we know, the other jobs we've done up
until now have been for Kamishiro, too.
Chinese:
目前接下的委託裡，說不定也有幾件，
是神代企業所指示的。
Korean:
어쩌면 그 동안 받은 의뢰도 몇 가지는
카미시로의 지시였을지도 몰라
German:
Nach allem, was wir wissen, könnten die anderen
Aufträge, die wir bisher erledigt haben, ebenfalls
von Kamishiro gekommen sein.

English:
I tried to talk to him, but he wouldn't listen.
They're using the cost of Erika's therapy to
control him.
Chinese:
我雖然想說服他收手，但沒有用。
那傢伙，為了小姐的治療費而去做這些骯髒事。
Korean:
손을 끊으라고 설득했지만 소용없었어.
그 녀석은 아가씨의 치료비를 대가로 더러운 일을 강요당하고 있지
German:
Ich habe versucht, mit ihm zu sprechen, aber er
wollte nicht zuhören. Sie benutzen die Kosten für
Erikas Behandlung als Druckmittel.

English: ...Erika's life is on the line.
Chinese: ……這關係到小姐的生命。
Korean: ……아가씨의 목숨이 걸렸어
German: ... Erikas Leben steht auf dem Spiel.

English:
I can't just quit the team, but...
I think I'll join up with the Rebels for now.
Chinese:
雖然我不是想脫離隊伍……
但我想跟反叛者一起行動。
Korean:
팀을 빠지겠다는 건 아니지만……
난 리벨리온즈와 함께 갈 생각이야
German:
Ich kann das Team nicht einfach verlassen, aber –
ich glaube, ich werde mich für eine Weile den
Rebels anschließen.

English:
Ryuji is taking orders from Kishibe and planning
to go to Under Zero.
Chinese: 龍司接受岸部的指示，打算去Under Zero。
Korean: 류지는 키시베의 지령으로 언더 제로를 목표로 삼고 있거든
German:
Ryuji nimmt Befehle von Kishibe an und will
nach Unter Null.

English:
I'm going too.
So I can stop him if anything happens.
Chinese:
所以我也要去。
到時候不管發生什麼，我都要能夠阻止他。
Korean:
그러니까 나도 갈거야.
무슨 일이 있으면 녀석을 막을 수 있도록
German:
Ich gehe auch.
Damit ich ihn aufhalten kann, falls was passiert.

English:
The Rebels are working on some kind of Under Zero
plan too. So I'll just tag along.
Chinese:
反叛者們也說他們以攻略Under Zero為目標，
所以，我就跟他們一起行動了。
Korean:
리벨리온즈 녀석들도 언더 제로 공략이 목표라고 해.
그러니까 편승하도록 하겠어
German:
Die Rebels arbeiten auch an einem Plan für
Unter Null. Also komm ich einfach mit.

English:
I also gotta make sure Nokia and those guys don't
get into too much trouble.
Chinese:
而且都把諾奇雅他們也牽扯進來了，
可不能放任他們不管啊。
Korean: 노키아네가 휘말리게 내버려 둘 수는 없으니까
German:
Außerdem muss ich sicherstellen, dass Nokia und
diese Typen sich keinen allzu großen
Ärger einhandeln.

English:
They're strong, but they're still a new team, and
they got like zero skill--
Chinese:
這群傢伙還只是剛成立的隊伍，
做事亂七八糟，也沒有強大的技能──
Korean:
이 녀석들 아직 막 만들어진 팀이고
하는 짓도 엉망진창이고 강하지도 않고 스킬도 없지만――
German:
Sie sind stark, aber sie sind noch ein neues Team
und haben noch nichts drauf ...

English:
Someone who knows what they're doin' needs to keep
an eye on 'em.
Chinese: ……但總覺得，不能拋下他們啊。
Korean: …어쩐지 내버려 둘 수 없거든
German:
Sie brauchen jemanden, der weiß, was er tut und
sie im Auge behält.

English: Don't worry too much, [p]!
Chinese: 別擔心了啦，[p]！
Korean: 걱정하지 마, [p] 군!
German: Zerbrich dir nicht den Kopf, [p]!

English:
Once Chitose and Ryu-what's-his-face make up,
Chitose will help out at Hudie again!
Chinese:
只要千歲跟龍一和好後，我們就會把千歲
好～好地還回去hudie的喔！
Korean:
치토세와 류이치 군이 화해하는데 성공하면 치토세는 후디에로
제~대로 돌려줄테니까!
German:
Sobald Chitose und Ryudingsbums wieder gut
miteinander sind, hilft Chitose wieder bei
Hudie mit!

English:
Having Chitose on our team would make us a
thousand times stronger, but stealing hackers from
other teams isn't cool!
Chinese:
雖然千歲要是加入我們隊伍可就是超級戰力了……
但是搶走其他隊伍的駭客也太沒有禮貌了！
Korean:
물론 치토세가 팀에 들어와준다면 이 이상 없을 전력이겠지만…
다른 팀의 해커를 뺏는 건 매너 위반이니까!
German:
Chitose im Team zu haben, würde uns tausendmal
so stark machen, aber Hacker aus anderen Teams
abzuwerben, ist nicht in Ordnung!

English: So relax, okay?
Chinese: 所以你安心吧！
Korean: 그러니 안심해!
German: Also entspann dich, okay?

English:
Hey, Chitose!
Were you really an original Jude hacker?!
Chinese: 咦，千歲從前是Jude的駭客嗎？
Korean: 저기저기, 치토세는 원래 쥬드의 해커야?
German:
He, Chitose!
Warst du wirklich ursprünglich Hacker bei Gamma?

English: Yeah, that's right.
Chinese: 對，沒有錯喔。
Korean: 오우, 그렇지
German: Ja, das stimmt.

English:
We started the Rebels when we heard rumors about
Jude! You're like Nokia's hero!
Chinese:
我們是聽了Jude的傳聞後，才創立反叛者的喔。
千歲是諾奇雅她們的前輩呢！
Korean:
우리들, 쥬드의 소문을 듣고 리벨리온즈를 만들었어.
치토세는 노키아네의 선배네!
German:
Wir haben die Rebels gegründet, als wir die
Gerüchte über Gamma hörten! Du bist quasi
Nokias Held!

English: Oh really? He he... I kinda like that.
Chinese: 真的假的？　嘿嘿……總覺得好高興啊。
Korean: 그런 거야? 헤헷… 어쩐지 기쁜데
German: Ach ja? Hehe ... Das gefällt mir irgendwie.

English:
Well if there's anything you want me to teach ya,
just ask.
Chinese:
我雖然現在這樣，
但要是不嫌棄的話，我什麼都能教你們喔。
Korean:
지금은 이런 느낌이지만
나라도 괜찮다면 뭐든지 가르쳐줄게
German:
Tja, wenn’s irgendwas gibt, was ich euch
beibringen soll, dann fragt einfach.

English:
Seriously!? Well then...
What's the best food in the human world?
Chinese:
真的嗎！？　那麼──
人類世界最好吃的東西是什～麼～？
Korean:
정말!? 그러면―
인간 세계에서 가장 맛있는 밥은 뭐~야?
German:
Ernsthaft?! Wenn das so ist ...
Was ist das beste Essen in der Menschenwelt?

English: You wanna ask about food?
Chinese: 居然是問吃的啊！
Korean: 밥 얘기였냐?
German: Du fragst mich nach Essen?

English:
I want to know too!
Is there anything better than Kobe beef?
Chinese: 我也想知道！　有比頂極肉品更好吃的東西嗎？
Korean: 나도 알고 싶어! 최고급 고기보다 맛있는 것도 있어?
German:
Ich will es auch wissen!
Gibt es was Besseres als Kobe-Rindfleisch?

English:
Pfft! Agumon and Gabumon...
You guys are too much!
Chinese: 真是，亞古獸跟加布獸都這樣呆呆的。
Korean: 정말~ 아구몬, 파피몬은 재간둥이라니까~!
German:
Pfff! Agumon und Gabumon ...
Ihr seid mir zwei Helden!

English:
We don't have many chances like this!
We want to learn as much as we can from you until
you find your friend, Ryupi!
Chinese:
但是，這種機會可不常有啊，所以在找到
龍三之前，就讓千歲好好教教你們吧！
Korean:
하지만 이런 기회는 좀처럼 없으니까 류조 군을 찾을 때까지
치토세에게서 여러모로 가르침을 받도록 하자!
German:
So eine Chance bietet sich uns nicht oft! Wir
wollen so viel wie möglich lernen, bevor du
deinen Freund Ryupi findest!

English:
Okay, leave it to me! And by the way, my friend's
name is Ryuji! For some reason it keeps evolving.
Chinese:
包在我身上吧！……還有，我的好夥伴叫龍司！
你們從剛剛開始就一直微妙地搞錯了。
Korean:
맡겨둬!  ……그리고 내 친구의 이름은 류지야!
아까부터 미묘하게 틀리잖아
German:
Okay, ich kümmer mich drum! Und übrigens heißt
mein Freund Ryuji! Auch wenn es sich anscheinend
keiner merken kann.

English: ...And that's that.
Chinese: ……就是這樣啦。
Korean: …그렇게 됐으니까
German: ... Und so viel dazu.

English: Go on back to the shop and help Erika out.
Chinese: 就拜託你回店裡，待在小姐身邊吧。
Korean: 너는 가게에 남아서 아가씨 곁에 있어주라
German: Geh zurück zum Café und hilf Erika.

English: ...Don't say anything about Ryuji yet.
Chinese: 龍司的事情……還別跟她說。
Korean: 류지에 대한 건……아직 말하지 말아줘
German: ... Sag vorerst nichts über Ryuji.

English:
...Sorry to lay that on you.
I know it'll be tough to keep it secret from her.
Chinese:
……真抱歉啊，讓你負責這種苦差事。
要對小姐保持沉默會很難受吧？
Korean:
……미안한걸. 손해보는 역할을 맡겨버려서.
아가씨에게 아무 말도 하지 않는 건 힘들겠지
German:
... Entschuldige, dass ich dir das aufbürde.
Ich weiß, dass es schwierig wird,
ihr das vorzuenthalten.

English:
C'mon, cheer up!
Don't go back with that hangdog look on your face!
Chinese:
別～露出那種表情嘛！　你這大眾臉！
你就算擺那種表情也上不了鏡頭啦！
Korean:
그~런 얼굴 하지 말라니까! 이 평범 얼굴!
네가 그런 얼굴 해 봤자 돋보이지 않아!
German:
Ach, Kopf hoch! Sieh nicht so zerknirscht drein,
wenn du zurückgehst!

English:
I'm telling ya, don't worry!
When it's all over, I'll come right back.
Chinese:
你就別擔心了。
結束以後，我馬上就會回去了。
Korean:
걱정하지 마.
끝나면 바로 돌아갈 거야
German:
Ich sagte doch, mach dir keine Sorgen!
Wenn alles vorbei ist, komme ich gleich zurück.

English:
After all, I can't leave the job of watchin' over
that brother and sister to a newbie!
Chinese: 要照顧那對兄妹，可不能推給你這新人啊！
Korean: 그 남매를 돌보는 일을 신입에게 떠넘기기만 할 수는 없으니까!
German:
Schließlich kann ich es keinem Neuling überlassen,
auf diese Geschwister aufzupassen!
